revised_title: Observations on the Effects of Extreme Cold and the Behavior of Salts in Solution
tldr: The author investigates the effects of extreme cold on various salts in solution and their resistance to freezing. The experiments reveal that different salts have varying degrees of resistance to congelation, with sea salt having the least resistance. The author also discusses the potential implications of these findings in understanding the behavior of salts in natural environments, such as the ocean.
